description: To provide limits on the designation of new federally protected land.
To ensure that the storage and transportation of petroleum coke is regulated in a manner that ensures the protection of public and ecological health.
To express the sense of Congress regarding climate change.
To require the use of iron, steel, and manufactured goods produced in the United States in the construction of the Keystone XL Pipeline and facilities.
To express the sense of the Senate that climate change is real and not a hoax.
To ensure that oil transported through the Keystone XL pipeline into the United States is used to reduce United States dependence on Middle Eastern oil.
To express the sense of Congress regarding climate change.
To express the sense of Congress regarding federally protected land.
To conform citizen suits under the Endangered Species Act of 1973.
